TopicTitle: I need a craft that can lift ~6000 tons

Articles.Content:
Hey y'all.  To simply put my cry for help. 

I've got a small volume ~6000 ton payload and want to get it to ~100 km orbit.

Note I have the following mods 

  • KerbalResuabilityExpansion
  • KerbalTek
  • KIS/KAS
  • MechJeb2
  • Tweakscale
  • FShangerExpansion
  • EasyVesselSwitch.

I tried with all my masterful techniques but failed.  (Jk just really don't wan't to make it myself)

Who ever makes this booster will get the reward of seeing this amazing mission succeed that I have planned.  I call It The Intrepid-1

(Get ready for the biggest, coolest, and most meaningfully expensive mission ever!)

Thank you!

Edited September 18, 2018 by sumghai
Revert to standard forum post font, removed all-caps text

[MOD - Moved to Spacecraft Echange subforum, as this is a "solve my problem" request than an actual challenge]

@Exodus_Solis, please note that a "Challenge" must be something you have attempted and documented yourself.

For your ultra-heavy lifting, @Stratzenblitz75 got you covered:

download link in description

May I just ask why you need a 6000 ton payload? Is it not possible to break it into smaller pieces and send it up as smaller payloads? That might be a bit easier plus you don't have to worry about a giant 6000 ton mass and the inevitable computer killing part count.

You could try the SpaceY parts pack.

I've considered making a few massive booster parts before that essentially have a hollow core so you could haul massive things up to orbit, without thousands of booster parts stuck on the side.. At the cost of a massive ammount of fuel. Have a number of projects to finish first though.

You could send it up in small shuttles and assemble it in orbit, which will be easier (as long as you are good at docking).

Or you could cheat and use HyperEdit to get it into orbit
